node.text:
Here’s the truth about “FDA Approved”:

There’s a BIG misconception that the FDA diligently reviews and approves new ingredients before we start eating them. 

Sadly this isn’t the case. 

New ingredients are usually approved by the food manufacturer themselves, and NOT by the FDA. 

All an ingredient manufacturer has to do is HIRE THEIR OWN EXPERTS to claim it’s safe. This is the green light to start adding it to food products.

Several “FDA Approved” products have been yanked from the shelves after they were found to be downright dangerous. 

But this doesn’t happen overnight. 

History shows that it takes YEARS before the FDA acts and removes harmful products from the market. 

Something very serious needs to happen – like deaths – before the FDA takes action. And even then, they may not.

Remember how Johnson & Johnson’s talc powder was recently removed from the shelves after slews of cancer claims and cover-ups by the company?

Well, the FDA didn’t ban it. 

J&J voluntarily decided to stop selling it to stop lawsuits from piling up.

Meanwhile, this controversial ingredient is banned in Europe. 

This just goes to show how little the FDA has done to protect our health. 

Tag your friends below to spread the word!

node.text:
Once upon a time, I had cravings for sugary foods like granola bars or muffins as soon as I got up in the morning, but those cravings vanished after I began this habit. 

Now I crave whole and satisfying foods instead. 

Starting my day with a healthy action sets me up for success for the rest of the day and is a reminder that my health comes first.

Please tag your friends below to share this tip. This ritual is just too easy not to do – so drink up and start each day with this healthy habit!

Click the link in my bio to learn more!

node.title: I drink this first thing in the morning.

node.text:
This is it!

9 USDA Organic, easy-to-identify ingredients. 

No aluminium.
No parabens.
No other weird ingredients.
Just deodorant that works.

I believe what you put on your body is just as important as what you put in it.

Keep a clean trick up your sleeve with Truvani Organic Deodorant 😉

Click the link in my bio to learn more: Truvani.com

node.text:
Even though we’ve made tremendous progress…the truth is that big companies just don’t change fast enough.

I believe we deserve to live in a world where our products can be made without weird – and nasty – ingredients.

Is that too much to ask?

Apparently so. Because we are so far away it’s crazy.

So, I decided to take matters into my own hands.

I launched @truvani and we have one main goal: eliminate nasty ingredients from all daily-use products.

We started with supplements. Now we are creating personal care products. 

Visit Truvani.com to learn more.

I know you’ll like them. And when you see the ingredient labels, you’ll LOVE THEM.

node.title: Over the last decade, I fought for Ingredient Transparency.

node.text:
Watch and decide for yourself.

I was on @shaunt’s podcast this week and the food chemical loving trolls went wild! 

Check out my new blog post to watch the FULL VIDEO. And see how the food industry uses internet trolls to fool the public. 

It’s up now on FoodBabe.com/Blog 

@trustandbelievepod

We need to rise up. We need to stick together. 

We need to stand up to these corporate interests.

It's for our health, our family's health and to change the world.

node.text:
I used to LOVE when my mom bought Orange Creamsicles as a child and ate them all summer long. Back then, we had no idea how bad the ingredients were in those little suckers!

Store-bought Orange Creamsicles are PACKED with seven different types of refined sugar: corn syrup, high fructose corn syrup, maltodextrin, sugar, fructose, corn syrup solids, and orange juice “concentrate”. 

Did you know that juice “concentrate” is juice that is boiled down to a syrup? This heating process destroys beneficial nutrients and turns it into refined sugar. Some experts say it is similar to high-fructose corn syrup!

Then they add in several controversial emulsifiers, “natural” flavors, and conventional milk. 

Thankfully, I’ve figured out how to recreate this summertime staple with 100% real food ingredients which are actually healthy for you! 

Food Babe’s Orange Creamsicle Pops
Serves: 6 to 8

Ingredients:
1 cup culinary coconut milk
1½ bananas, peeled
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Pinch sea salt
3 large oranges, juiced

Directions:
1.  Place the coconut milk, bananas, vanilla, and salt in a blender. Blend until smooth. 
2. Using popsicle molds, fill each mold with 1 tablespoon of orange juice. Top with 1 tablespoon of coconut milk mix. 
3. Place the popsicle sticks in the center of the molds and let freeze for at least 1 hour. 
4. After 1 hour take the popsicle mold out of the freezer and repeat with 1 tablespoon of orange juice and 1 tablespoon of coconut milk mix in each mold. Place back in the freezer for at least 2 hours to freeze. 

Get more real food recipes like this in my cookbook: FoodBabeKitchen.com

Fragrance.

“Fragrance” can mean a combination of 3,000+ chemicals on an ingredients list.

So, how do we smell great without “Fragrances”?

node.text:
One of the best things you can do for your health and immune system is to avoid refined sugar, which means white sugar, corn syrup, and processed sugars. You see – there is little to no nutritional value in refined sugars. Eating refined sugar is addictive, makes you fat, tired, depressed, age faster, makes your skin dull, weakens immunity and when consumed in excess causes all sorts of diseases… No thanks.

Think about the natural options you have available that will satisfy your sweet tooth – depending on what you are craving:

🍫 Craving chocolate? Try a @Truvani plant-based protein chocolate smoothie sweetened with monk fruit. Or our new The Only Bar in Chocolate Love sweetened with dates and maple syrup. Or the homemade No Sugar Hot Chocolate from Food Babe Kitchen sweetened with dates. 

🍓 Craving fruit? Enjoy whole fruit or dried fruit. Sometimes I like organic cranberry tea - just make sure it doesn’t have natural flavors added. 

🍪 Craving something warm & comforting? Bake a batch of Forever Cookies from Food Babe Kitchen - sweetened only with real food (bananas, dates, and prunes). I’ll post the recipe at the link in my bio! 

🧊 Craving something cold? Make coconut milk ice cream sweetened with a frozen banana, or homemade freezer pops made with fresh pressed juice. 

Get the gist? See how easy that is?

Share these options with your friends by tagging them below!

node.text:
After finding out that Red 3 causes cancer in animal studies the FDA banned it from cosmetics in 1990. Yet, the FDA still permits Red 3 in our food and you’ll find it in chewing gum, Ensure drinks, Pediasure Drinks, Nesquik Strawberry Milk, popsicles, ice creams, fruit cocktails, candy, and Kellogg’s new Unicorn Waffles – but you won’t find it legally in lipstick. 

In 1989 it was reported that the fruit industry was “enraged” by the FDA’s proposal to ban Red 3 from food, because “Americans like their cherries red” in a can. 

"People are going to lose a lot of money”, they said. 

So they lobbied the House Appropriations Committee to add language to it’s report that “instructed the FDA not to ban the dye-formally titled FD&C red No. 3-without further study.” 

This is in violation of the “Delaney Clause” that requires the FDA to ban carcinogenic food ingredients. When they banned Red 3 in cosmetics, the FDA said it would “take steps” to ban it in food too. Well, it’s been over 30 years, and we are still waiting for the FDA to take action on Red 3. 

Just because the FDA approves it, doesn’t mean food companies should use it. When are food companies going to be held accountable for using controversial and potentially cancerous chemicals in their products? Especially products made for children. It’s outrageous!

Please spread the word by sharing this post. 

Subscribe to learn the truth about your food: FoodBabe.com/Subscribe

node.text:
These are the wraps that I packed for my road trip to the beach if you’ve been following along on my stories. I love these wraps! The pickles and the sprouts are essential to what makes this wrap so great, so make sure you have those ingredients. It packs easily and you can even bring it on an airplane (just wrap it in parchment and put it in a clear bag). This would also be perfect for a quick healthy lunch to bring to the office, so you aren’t tempted into getting fast food. Just think how much healthier we all would be if we ate this instead of Chick-Fil-A and Subway for lunch!

Tag your friends below to share this recipe.

Food Babe's Favorite Sprout Wrap (makes 2 wraps)

Ingredients:
2 sprouted grain tortillas (gluten free: use collard leaf)
2 tablespoons dijon mustard
2 cups broccoli sprouts or sprouts of choice
1 avocado, peeled, pitted and mashed
½ tomato, thinly sliced
½ red onion, thinly sliced
2 carrots, shredded
2 pickles, sliced
1 cup chopped romaine

Directions:
1. Take one of the tortillas and spread 1 tablespoon of mustard down the center. 
2. Layer with ½ of the sprouts, avocado, tomato, red onion, carrots and pickles. 
3. Top with ½ of the romaine lettuce and roll. Enjoy!

node.text:
People always ask me: Why does the FDA allow these risky chemicals in our children’s food? 

The truth is, the FDA is asleep at the wheel.

The FDA allows ingredient manufacturers to hire THEIR OWN EXPERTS to “prove” their newly invented ingredients are safe. This is the green light to start adding it to food products. 

This is why food companies are allowed to use the most profitable ingredients they can find, with zero regard for our health. 

Even after an ingredient is shown to cause serious health problems, it takes YEARS before the FDA removes it from the market, if ever. 

For example...

Just a few years ago, you could hardly find any crackers, cakes, or cookies at the supermarket that weren’t made with “Partially Hydrogenated Oil”. Food companies loved to use this ingredient because it's CHEAP and helped their products last a long time on the shelf…But it turns out that this ingredient was full of Trans Fat, which was giving people heart attacks. 

Even after the CDC came out and said trans fats were causing up to 7,000 deaths and 20,000 heart attacks per year, the FDA kept letting companies like Pillsbury and Betty Crocker continue to use this ingredient in their products for years. The FDA finally banned partially hydrogenated oils in 2015, but allowed companies 3 YEARS to find a replacement ingredient. How many people died of heart attacks during this time? 

So, how much does the FDA really protect us?

Look at what they allow Trix to market to your children. Artificial colors made from petroleum that are known to cause hyperactivity + GMOs laced with carcinogens, spiked with huge amounts of addicting sugar. It’s sad and disgusting. 

There are still a lot of people who don’t know what ingredients like Yellow 6 and Blue 1 could be doing to their health or the health of their kids. We still need to reach these people! That’s why it’s important to keep sharing this information. 

Please SHARE this. We still have so much work to do and need to keep spreading the truth!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Vani Hari | Food Babe on August 23, 2021. Preservalives VEGETABLEAND FOTATOSNACK NETWT502141g FOOD BABE Vani Hari'.

node.text:
I get a lot of heat when I talk about this, but…here’s the truth about Veggie Straws. 

I know the fact that they have “Veggie” in the name makes it sound good for you, but it’s a sham.

✔️Veggie Straws are really just chips. 

✔️Just like potato chips, they are mostly made from conventional potatoes and fried in vegetable oils. 

✔️Even the organic version found at Costco (swipe left to see them) is processed corn and potato flour fried in unhealthy refined oils. 

✔️These oils are not healthy for the body because they are very high in Omega 6 fatty acids, which leads to inflammation. Munching on low quality foods like this has led millions of Americans to diseases like obesity, heart disease, diabetes and cancer.

✔️The “spinach powder” and “beetroot powder” in veggie chips are really just tiny amounts of vegetable powders added, which primarily add color to the chips. This doesn’t make the product any healthier, just prettier. 

These are marketed as a healthy alternative to chips, and many daycares and schools serve these. We need to get the word out. 

Please tag your friends below and share this to your story to spread the truth! 

If you’re looking for healthy snacks - I’ll post a link in my bio with over 100 packaged snacks made without refined flours and sugars.

node.text:
Tag all the parents you know! It’s back to school time and a lot of kids will have these in their lunchbox. 

There are three types of refined sugar added to Nabisco’s Fig Newtons: regular sugar, corn syrup, and invert sugar. All of these refined sugars are associated with obesity, heart disease, cancer, dementia, and liver damage. You’ll eat 8 grams of added sugar in just two small Fig Newtons. And how many of us can stop at just two cookies?

It's also made with canola oil - a heavily refined oil that goes through an insane amount of processing with chemical solvents (like hexane, a neurotoxin), steamers, neutralizers, de-waxers, bleach, and deodorizers. 

I’m not picking on Fig Newtons. (Well, maybe just a little.) I’m calling out these cookies because they market themselves as a healthier alternative. If Fig Newtons are this bad, just imagine what an “unhealthy” cookie is like.

Fig Newtons are an example of the Big Food industry at work. These corporations are really good at selling us fake food, produced in giant factories from a long list of already highly processed ingredients. They sell us these products because they are highly profitable, even if it means we’re consuming dangerous chemicals, additives, and toxic ingredients.

Good News: 

You can make “Fig Newtons” at home with good ingredients. And they’re just as chewy and satisfying as the original. Even better, actually.

Swipe left for the recipe!

This recipe is out of my cookbook, available here: FoodBabeKitchen.com
